Review.Titre: Harsh treble, lacking bass, static with Hellblocker mode
Review.Contenu: I didn't like the sound signature, they were rather harsh in the treble and the bass was lacking, considering the two woofers in each earcup. The Hellblocker mode, or ANC, is rather weak and there's a static sound in the right earcup that you can hear when using Hellblocker. I'm told that there's an app coming that will push through an update to fix that, but there's no ETA for it. So, I'm stuck with headphones I don't like and I cannot sell because they are defective.

Review.Titre: Anti climax and poor PR/ Customer service
Review.Contenu: The headphones I received sounded plain awful. I enquired about a replacement or refund and was told that as I pledged through Kickstarter, I was not entitled to anything. I was quiet an early backer and waited 19 months for the headphones to turn up. Then I found out hundreds of people who paid much much later through heavy’s own website received theirs weeks before early bird backers like myself and they were entitled to refunds/ replacements if faulty. The headphones, just like the company and customer service are bitterly disappointing.

The whole campaign was a mess. The communication on this Kickstarter was awful and extremely misleading. The headphones themselves, when they finally showed up, were near unlistenable and needed immediate EQ to be usable. I wouldn't pay $100 for these, I'm sour that I paid $150, and would never suggest anyone pay retail for these massive pillars of mediocrity to such an awfully ran company. I would give a negative rating if I could and will never recommend anyone use these. Anyone who has any idea about headphones already has a better pair and the company is straight garbage. It would take way too long to recount every bit of ridiculous behavior from start to finish and no one would care if I did.

Delivery of the product was over a year late.  The headphones are very heavy and they are not comfortable to wear for over 10 minutes.  The sound can be described as mushy or muddy.  The voice UI is not only corny but rather annoying and difficult to understand in contrast to the music.  The case both ugly and cumbersome. Even after a full year of delays, this product seems extremely rushed and unpolished.

Review.Titre: Heavys does not care about its customers
Review.Contenu: Heavys does not offer communication to its' customers.  Instead, it opts to keep them in the dark and lie to them about communicating.  Many of the people who initially backed Heavys have yet to receive their headphones, after years of delays and being lied to (we are shipping this month, which is next month, or the month after, or...) - Heavys has not given any update to those Kickstarter backers for three months - just shows Heavys does not care about its customers.  You can buy their new shirts, though, or order headphones through their website, but the headphones customers initially bought and are waiting for have not arrived because, again, this company does not care about its customers.  And the product does not live up to expectations - they sound like mud.

The headphones are terrible. They are very muffled and quite bass heavy. The range is very limited. I expected so much more.  I have a $30 pair of headphones that sound infinitely better. I feel ripped off. The usb cord included is cheap. The headphones are small and uncomfortable on my head. Incredibly disappointed with this inferior product.
Customer service was difficult to communicate with and failed to cancel my order before it shipped. Once I received the product everything sounded sludgy and muddled even metal.

They are big and fall off my head with the slightest movement. They are also heavy so that makes it worse. I let the company know my concerns, but nobody got back to me.ETA. After contacting customer support I'm knocking my review down to one star. They absolutely ignored my question and were rude. Too bad I can't return these. I  was excited about the tech, but am totally soured by their customer service.

Review.Pseudo: Idiot for Giving You My Money
Review.Contenu: Your company is shady. I was sent a notice on August 12 that my item was shipping. Shortly afterward, I received a USPS tracking email. I did not receive my headphones on the day I was supposed to. In fact, the message stated the post office was still waiting to receive the item from heavys. After some back and forth with customer service I was then sent a fabricated screenshot—there were no active links for me to check on the status—stating my headphones would be delivered that day, which was roughly 6 weeks ago. I never got them. When I reached out to customer service again, I was sent a new tracking link that stated UPS was the delivery method, not the USPS: the link pointed me to UPS, but when I clicked on the tracking number it sent me back to my original USPS info, stating my headphones would be delivered by August 23 (that was in the middle of September). I inquired about this and was then told I had to check with customs. But the point of origin was San Leandro: 30 miles from my house. I’m speaking with my credit card company to get my money back and inform them of the company’s shady business practices. This is absolutely one of the most horrible purchasing experiences I’ve ever had.

Review.Titre: Two stars for the product, minus ten for the customer service
Review.Contenu: I was one of the early backers on Kickstarter. I will not talk about the process from day one until shipping had begun. This is irrelevant for my review.It took them over 5 months from „your headphones are ready for shipment“ until we actually received them. During that time the pi**-poor communication skills and the arrogance of the so-called customer service showed the sad truth behind heavys: as long as they get their money, those who pay it and their rights or feelings don’t matter. Whatsoever. We didn’t get a functioning tracking number and our package ended up in a holding facility - which resulted in almost 30€ of additional fees. Thank you heavys! On top of customs, not customs as such.The headphones themselves are quite good, although the hell blocker is a non functional joke of a sales pitch. It literally doesn’t do anything. On both pairs we ordered…I have no urge to contact the people at heavys again to be ridiculed and pi**ed off. I will sell mine, I simply do not want to endorse this brand at all. Creating a good product isn’t everything. Throughout their journey the people at heavys have forgotten who they owe their initial success to. Sad quintessence of almost 2 years of waiting.EDIT: Heavy's: your message is the most generic blabla and actually quite appalling. Too little, too late. No one cared when it mattered the most. Why should I waste my time on this now?As I said, I will not endorse your brand anymore and you have lost the faith and support of an entire group of people over here. The people who had the displeasure to be in contact with your so-called customer support on Kickstarter all report the same - as clearly visible on here. I would fire them straight away. If the headphones would work well at least, that'd be one thing but those things are not anywhere near what was promised, way too big and heavy and the most appealing function - for me and my husband - the hellblocker - is just a nice word you implemented. No function.But whatever I am writing here will not change anything anyways. You've "made it". Your brand is out there and there are enough people (ohhh wheee: famous ones, too!) endorsing and celebrating you. Congrats. Why on earth should this matter to you at this point?I don't like being held for stupid. You could have helped when I had asked you for help. Instead I was ridiculed and actively ignored. You showed a very ugly face throughout the process. So: no thanks Heavy's. I'm very much done with you.
These headphones have been "ready to start shipping" for over a year now.They have had my money, but I have no headphones. They simply don't exist.

Review.Titre: The sound quality is so poor I think…
Review.Contenu: The sound quality is so poor I think they may be broken.

This is not a finished product. Industrial design was stated as completed in Dec 2021 but they are still prototyping now.I have serious doubts they will meet a Feb '23 delivery perhaps even ever deliver anything and the product has not been released for review to any trusted third party so there is no honest third party feedback.Some comments from their backersKudos2 minutes agoWhen you launched the compaign in January it was with the statement that "Industrial Design was complete".In May "Manufacturing for Headphones + Travel Case is on track".At the end of June "We are expecting the first samples with the final CMF to be ready by mid-July."In September "we are in the prototype stage" but the delay is a "supply chain" issue.You don't seem to be able to articulate what is going on and I have no idea what the status of the product is. As far as I can tell you're still prototyping the design.Wes Ewingabout 6 hours agoProgress is progress! Good reminder about supply chain challenges. My prediction is that these may start to ship in 2023 Q1. Only time will tell.Stephen DisneySuperbackerabout 6 hours agoGuys... Cross your fingers for Summer 2023... Calling it.Vulkandrabout 7 hours agoSo are we still on track for November 17th? Because i assumed the delay was to make sure production is done by mid October and they can arrive by mid November, but by the looks of things, full production hasn't even started and we're halfway through September. This is very little time to still be adjusting the hinge and sound and still production done for a November release. We going to get another delay at the start of November?Chris Mascatelloabout 8 hours agoI can't help but be concerned that we are still WAYS away from shipping product. These seem like mid-Beta stage tweaks coming out of the R&D shop via 3D printing. Head-clamp pressure increase via the main headband, modified hinges, and physical EQ plates are not simple adjustments and would certainly need to clear at least one round of QC manufacturing in China before being "locked". While these tweaks will be beneficial to the finished product and see us all from getting pre-Beta-grade units as the "finished" product, I do think we need and deserve a truthful update on the production schedule.Gerald Habout 8 hours agoThanks for the Update and unfortunately I agree with Chris. You are working on the weakest points, which are the hinges, but also want to change the pressure of the head-clamp, which will make the hinges weak again. Also the video just stopped after 3:46 when Axel was talking about the PCB?!?! November 2022 is very challanging goal for the shipment, also it is black friday and something following on a monday, meaning the chaotic global shipment will get more crazy.Gal Langfordabout 8 hours agoI unfortunately am also agreeing on this. I feel like the updates are not consistent, I understand things change, but I can't help but being skeptical, I backed this project for a promise for an amazing cutting edge product, I hope we will actually get it, I am a little concerned for what our friends are saying here.

Review.Titre: I had high hopes for these headphones…
Review.Contenu: I had high hopes for these headphones but sadly they don't sound any better than my old $40.00 JBLs. The volume isn't loud enough unless I turn it all the way up to the "red zone" These headphones are very large and bulky. I am an average size woman and if I do any head banging at all (or even running) they would fall off. The Only thing I do like about them is that the ear piece is very comfortable.

First off, I was charged for UPS shipping,they arrived via usps without alerting me with tracking no#,left on my door step, miracle they weren't stolen. 2. They're not loud enough,Samsung S7 tablet cranked,still couldn't "get off " very disappointed. I will try them with a device with a higher output level. And append my review. Depth of bass, spatial separation,severely lacking, I was expecting the crunchy distorted midrange tones to be emphasized and tweaked because this is where most headphones fall flat, my floyd rose EP150 open box for $30 sound better and have the output to get the job done.  However, they do shine when playing guitar through amp/cab stimulators,   this is where they will find a home with me.  As of yet no one has invented a headset for metal that "gets us off"

Review.Titre: No idea how they’re rated so high
Review.Contenu: I was very excited to get these. I received them today, charged them fully and connected them to my iPhone via Bluetooth.The only way I can describe the way these sound is it sounds like you’re listening to music under water. There’s no highs, minimal bass and nearly all the sound is mids. It’s terribly muffled, bland and just blah. Even turning them up to max volume was muted at best. Unfortunately a very underwhelming experience.Even different EQ settings on my iPhone did nothing to make them sound better.The one positive thing I can say about them is the build quality seems very high on the headphones and the case, but what’s that matter if they just don’t sound good?I replaced a broken (very hard use over years) pair of Skullcandy Hesh 3’s with these. The Hesh 3’s were amazing. These, not so much. I will be returning my Heavy’s and have already replaced them with a new pair of Skullcandy Crusher ANC2’s.The difference is night and day and they come with an app that allows you to customize the sound of the headphones completely.I wanted these to be good, but they just weren’t. MAYBE I got a bad pair? No way to know I guess.

Review.Titre: They are a huge disappointment as the…
Review.Contenu: They are a huge disappointment as the sound quality is no better than much cheaper brands of headphones.  The voice when they are turned on/off/HB is super annoying and completely unnecessary.  They definitely aren't worth what I paid for them or the almost year wait to receive them.  The protective case is the best feature for the product though which is why I gave a 2 star rating rather than a 1 star rating.

Not a fan of the touch controls on other ANC Headphone options.

Was extremely disappointed in the volume level, or lack thereof. The sound quality is good, they were comfortable but my cheap pair of sonys with a dac achieve the same results. I will be returning...

These headphones, they're not living up to the promises and claims. The marketing had me thinking I'd be getting some top-notch sound (for this price-range in headphones), but, truth be told, they've left me feeling a bit scammed. And let me tell you, as a bassist, the disappointment is real.I was pumped about these headphones, thinking they'd give me that high-resolution sound without burning a hole in my pocket. But nope, wrong call. The bass, especially in metal music, is all over the place - messy and muffled. It's like they're missing the memo on what good bass should sound like.And can we talk about the price? It's way off the mark for what you're getting. I was expecting a sweet deal, but now I'm just regretting the whole purchase. The sound quality, especially in the bass, is just not cutting it, and to top it off, it feels like they slapped on an extra cost for no good reason.I was hoping for that perfect combo of affordable and killer sound, but these headphones missed the mark big time. As a bassist, I need that low end to hit just right, and these headphones are nowhere close. It's like gearing up for an epic bass solo and getting a lackluster rumble instead.If you're into music, especially the heavy stuff, these headphones might not be your best bet. The sound quality is a miss, and the price feels like a punch in the gut. Save yourself the disappointment and look elsewhere if you're after a truly immersive audio experience.In general, I think Heavys is more about marketing than really delivering improvement on listening experience for metalheads...Hopefully, @Heavys, can you fix the sound issues with a decent app. I am truly not the only one with this issue... A decent equalizer to balance the sound

So more than two years and 215EUR down the line... the very first impressions are... meh, just meh.- "The voice" gimmick pissed me off in the first 5 minutes of use: it's too loud and pointless, just a gimmick, irritating myself and everyone around me.- 3.5 to 2.5 jack change was a dick move.- Why did they even bother with an AUX connection? With power off or on they sound muddy and thick as pig dung (this is not the word I wanted to use, but Trustpilot censored that).- BT is somewhat better. Cycling through different available A2DP codecs the sound is salvageable. Will have to try some EQ or wait for the app.- USB-C (I'm using my own 240W rated cable. Didn't even unpack the one it came with) is comparable to BT.So was it worth the money and the wait? No, not really... in this price range anyone can get a pair of decent headphones that perform as well, if not better, with arguably better "user interface" and customer support, and with added benefit of not having to waist 2 years.Update 2023-10-30I've been listening to metal for 3 decades and all of a sudden, according to Heavys, I don't know what metal is suppose to sound like? Well I'm sure metal is not suppose to sound like whatever comes out of H1H, thats for sure.

The headphones themselves have been fine. I expected to be a bit more wowed given the hype, but I suppose that's on me for buying into it a bit too much. Out of the box they sounded pretty muddled, but thankfully they sounded much better after using an equalizer. Still, not what you'd want from a set of headphones supposedly designed for exactly the type of music you're using them for.On the other hand, the way that Heavys conducted themselves over the course of fulfilling their Kickstarter campaign only became more disappointing over time. I'm not even upset by the delays (every campaign these days suffers from them), but rather that they'd only announce them as they missed their own deadlines. At some point (backer update #24 on Kickstarter), they even admitted that the process typically takes 2-3 years, yet for some reason thought their "optimism" would make fulfillment within a year realistic. I'm not sure how many crowdfunding campaign runners need to hear it, but backers don't want optimistic timelines, we want realistic ones. I'd rather be told upfront that something will take 2-3 years to happen and be happily surprised if it comes in a little sooner than have the timeline pushed back over and over. Even over the course of shipping they've done so, saying first that everything will ship over the course of April to June. Then the next month for sure. Then the next. Come October 2023, there are still campaign backers who don't have their headphones and there's been no communication from the campaign since July. Not to mention that people who purchased via retail were getting their headphones before many backers. And they refused to give the actual numbers of units shipped/delivered, apparently proprietary information. I've had more than one other crowdfunding campaign (ones that were much larger than this one) able to give updates every 2 weeks (even if there wasn't much to say) and even tell backers how many units were processed and delivered in each region.Heavys could've kept a lot of goodwill by just being honest about the effort it'd take them to develop and ship. They only celebrated successes (that mainly came from early reviewers/people who got lucky enough to actually get their headphones delivered on time), but refuse to face their failures and admit them. The final product is ok (and when's the app coming?), but after this campaign, they sure won't be getting me as a return customer.
Where's the Bass? That's it. Metal Music has Bass and these fail in that field. Skullcandy is still the best in sound for my experience.
These headphones make me dizzy. They make me feel nauseous. Can I get a refund or does someone want to buy them from me?

Review.Titre: This review is not for the product itself, but for the delivery.…
Review.Contenu: This review is not for the product itself, but for the delivery of it. I purchased the headphones on Black Friday, with the assumption it would be delivered before December 15, day I went abroad for my holidays. On the website, it said 5 to 10 business days. Heavys uses a company called Asendia. Their Honk Kong branch shipped my headphones to France, instead of Canada. Their tracking system is horrendous, without updates for weeks at a time. My headphones have finally arrived in Canada and I’m abroad. I was able to contact Heavys customer service and they have been very helpful, reason why I updated my review from one star to three stars. Once I actually wear it, I will update the review once again.

no audible effect when turning on the ANC. The parallel television sound, the sound of the lawn mower or a motorcycle driving past, was only subtly muffled. The quality is what should be expected at the price point.  Sound isolation is slightly better than expected but volume just isnt there.  I have some OG Beats that get way louder and keep the bass relatively clean without much distortion of the sound.I also practically forgot I ordered these things - thought the company was a scam because I kept seeing ad's but never getting a delivery.

H1H sounds good, but they are not the expected revolution that would reveal new notes in Heavy Metal songs I listen to everyday. They are good headphones for a 200$ price point. Two issues with H1H : Engaging Hell Blocker mode results in static noises make Hell Blocker unusable. Second, plugging them require a 2.5mm-3.5mm micro cable (like SH Headphoens), it degrades sounds quality vs Bluetooth (?!?) and brings inconsistent sound from left and right until you find the sweet spot for the headphone ends (2.5mm). On mine or it is stopping a bit before the cable can be inserted completely.

Battery lifetime unexpectedly short. I use them to listen music approx 18h a day whit about 80% volume level. Some days they doesn't last even that. The overall rest is good, considering I never had decent pair of headphones to compare.

Review.Titre: Despite the hype, the experience is far from comfortable or enjoyable.
Review.Contenu: Despite the hype, the sound quality is nothing extraordinary and even subpar in many cases. Yes, as promised, they are loud and banging, but that's a stigma that metalheads want just that, not really a reality. I was hoping for clarity of sound and wide range of frequencies, where everything isn't drown in bass. Unfortunatelly, that's not the case here, as the bass still swallows everything and the "being in concert" feature of spatial sound detracts from the experience more than its worth. On top of that, the earphones are literally heavy on the head, cumbersome and not very comfortable.

Speakers are great, battery is very long, but the earphone isn’t comfortable to wear outside. Running or working out is just not doable.I still have my old earphone around, it’s quite weird using two earphones, but… Heavys wasn’t able to fulfill all the aspects I expected.

Review.Titre: Alert voice is a piece of trash that pollutes the sound environment
Review.Contenu: 5 stars for Heavys H1H sound, especially for lossy sound like youtube. I almost don't need EQ for that.1 star for its alert voice, It's a piece of trash that pollutes the sound environment but H1H does not have any way to get rid of.

Review.Titre: Not cheap for what you get
Review.Contenu: Good build quality. Decent noise canceling (could be better) great mic for taking phone calls. Sound quality is decent and they don't go very loud. For the cost I'm a little disappointed, was really looking for to some bonecrushing metal to sounds as they say it is supposed to.

Value for money I don't think these are worth 300$ at full retail. 200$ tops is what I'd spend on these headphones.Sound quality is decent but I think they sounded best via USB-C to PC with a 3rd party audio enhancer like Windows Sonic. Music and movies sound good but as soon as you get to about 75% max volume you get distortions in the audio.The 4 speakers is a little gimmicky to be honest. I've had other multi speaker headphones in the past and they were the same. It's just too hard to differentiate the different speakers with them so close to your ears.You have to be a little carefully when pulling the headset off your head cause the small tweeters can catch your ear.All in all I just can't justify 300$ price point when there are way more feature packed headphones out there for cheaper.

Review.Titre: I was curious about HEAVYS' novel approach
Review.Contenu: I was curious about HEAVYS' novel approach to its design and, as a fan of Sennheiser headphones, backed the project due to Axel Grell's involvement in its design.I must say, out of the box, I found the HEAVYS H1H too dark, with some muddying of the low-end, possibly due to the way it was tuned, affecting the mid and higher frequencies. As such, EQ is essential, and once a relatively flat response with a slight bass shelf is dialled in, the outcome is quite satisfactory - they will also go quite loud! However, not having a dedicated app (for mobile use) with EQ is a bit of a blow.On a more positive note, the user interface is great, they are comfortable, folds to a compact size for travelling, and have superb battery life. The build quality is good too. However, one could do without the power on-off confirmation, which may be replaced by a simple two-tone notification.Is a mobile app (for Android 8.0+ and iOS) on the horizon? Now that will be a very useful feature.

HEAVYS look and feel awesome, come with a really nice case and are packaged well. Unfortunately, thats all the cons for me. Way to much bass for my enjoyment. The voice inside that says "power on", "battery high" etc. is uncomfortably loud. Don't notice any difference with 'Hell Blocker', and the switch is poorly placed sharing a 3-way with the power on/off. Headphone shells always look greasy cause of the matte style plastic. Overall quite disappointed and will be selling them.Sennheiser's have always been my go-to, so seeing a guy like Axel Grell designing these got my hopes up. Oh well.This is review is based my preferences and my hearing, Heavys are not poor quality, but they aren't for me.

They sound nice & clean but lack any ooomph. I had to but a iFi hip dac amplifier to enjoy them on the road but after 3 songs they go quiet. FRUSTRATING!!! At home they sound Awesome connected to my 2ch receiver but the 1/4” to 3.5mm to 2.5 mm reducing makes shorting sounds so I basically bought 2 sets for $500 that I can’t enjoy
Product is good for a value of around 150-200 euro’s. Customer service is crap! They abandoned their original backers who are still waiting for their headphones. They lack to respond on kickstarter.

Review.Titre: For the moment, too many issues to be considered a good product
Review.Contenu: I have received the headphones some week ago. First, I have something to say about the delivery: they shipped to Belgium more or less directly which is not very smart and caused me to pay a lot of import fees - better option would be to import through Netherlands.About the item itself, I have several doubts about the sound quality, that currently IMHO has several issues and I detailed them ... describing the caveats: they told me that when the android application will be ready, the software updates all these problems will disappear, so for the moment I have to wait.I hope so, but for the moment I regret my purchase.

I'm one of the Kickstarter backers. I think I was able to get some interesting headphones after waiting so long.It's well made, doesn't look cheap, and feels comfortable to wear.I think the ANC effect is appropriate and will not cause discomfort to many people.However, unfortunately the sound was not to my liking.Since it's only for heavy metal, I think you can enjoy the experience of being at a live venue when you play it at high volume. Those who gave it a high rating are definitely correct.However, I feel that the overall clarity is lacking, the sound is cloudy, the resolution is poor, and the presentation is lacking. Even in metal, some songs had mixed instruments that made me feel uncomfortable. This may be a matter of my preference rather than the good or bad of H1H.Active (Bluetooth or USB-C) mode is better, but Passive Analog Mode, which uses an AUX cable, has a noticeable downside.The sounds in active mode and passive analog mode are different. Passive analog mode feels unoptimized. Unlike regular headphones, the H1H has eight drivers, so it may be difficult to demonstrate its true potential in passive analog mode that does not utilize the H1H's optimized built-in DAC.By the way, if I use a third-party equalizer, I can get the sound closer to my preference, but that's a problem because I lose the flavor of the H1H. it's difficult.

I've had my H1H's since September 16, 2023, and have tried to use them regularly and with every kind of music I listen too. I was rewarded these headphones through the poorly mis-managed Kickstarter campaign. Pros: -Great overall range of sound ($150-200 range)-earcup comfort and size is excellent-overall build and materials feel very high quality-Transparent Mode is very good-ability to use it powered or un-powered (w/ aux cord)-Battery life is extremely long, even with high volumesCons: -Size of aviation headset (very large profile)-has significant weight that will tax your neck -imperfect sound profile (muddied sound at times)-Hell Blocker NC is not robust as competitors-Significant sound bleed-out from earcups on higher volumesOverall Impression: Heavys is a new company that fast-tracked the development and production of the H1H and it shows. These clunky, unapologetic headsets are either going to give the sound you want or they are not. If these are the most expensive headphone you've ever bought, they will impress you. If you already have $200-$300 headphones, you might have issues with the sound quality. The battery is robust and will allow you to travel without fear of needing to charge it during long flights, but the weight and design of the headphones can be taxing on your head and neck. Using the headphones for longer than three hours resulted in neck strain and headaches. Recommendation: There are very good headphones in the same price range. Heavys has the gimmick of 8 drivers but that doesn't mean the end-all-be-all to great sound quality. Shop around before settling on these "still developing" headphones.

The good: Heavys are by far the best-sounding headphones I have ever owned. The forward speakers really add dimension to the sound. I love the way the different frequencies are easily distinguishable. The bad: they are far too big for my head. On the smallest size, there is a gap between the headband and my head so the ear cups rest on my ears rather than the headband resting on my head. All of the weight is on my ears and it becomes very uncomfortable very quickly. They would absolutely be 5-star headphones if I could wear them for more than a few minutes before the pain set in.

Review.Titre: Really not a fan of these
Review.Contenu: After numerous delays, the headphones finally shipped and I’ve really felt little incentive to use them. It’s a subjective thing, but I think they make some of my favorite music (a lot of symphonic, extreme, and black metal) sound worse. They seem to work better for a lot of the industrial music I listen to. Definitely not what I was hoping for but I gave it a shot. I think for the money, there are better headphones out there. I’m just glad I was an early bird backer so I saved a bunch of money. At full retail, I cannot imagine anyone being happy with these as metal-specific headphones. Apparently there is an app coming that will allow EQ tweaks, but for now, there is nothing like that. While the noise cancellation is quite good, I am horribly annoyed by the stupid voice that announces every time I turn the headphones and noise cancellation on or off. It’s loud, intrusive and ridiculous.

The headphone audio is solid. However, there are a few noteworthy issues. First, my Heavys often produce a "crackling" sound - sort of a distortion or feedback, which is very distracting and disorienting while you're listening to music. Feels like a manufacturing fault. Second, the "doom voice" that gives spoken status updates such as "POWER ON" or "HELL BLOCKER ACTIVATED" - while amusing, in a corny way - is always set to the same volume level, which is quite loud. It's so loud that I have to take the Heavys off first before I do anything that will trigger the voice, because it hurts my ears. This is especially noticable if you're listening to music on lower volume (yes, even metalheads do this sometimes!). Ironically, if you turn the volume down TOO low, you will be greeted by the doom voice with a "MINIMUM VOLUME" warning that might blow you through the ceiling if you aren't expecting it, and also seems totally unnecessary. (Note: this only happens when using the on-headset volume knob. The same applies for "MAXIMUM VOLUME," but at that point it hardly matters). Lastly, and this may be nitpicking, but the headset is very large. Almost comically large. I feel a bit silly wearing it in public.Overall decent headphones for the price, but buyer beware.

The voice alert for turning on/off is FAR TOO loud, should be the same volume as the headset.

And skip the stupid loud voice telling me what is activated or not. It’s a good headphone, don’t get me wrong. But it is not for me. I rather stick to my Apple airpods pro.

My really own personal test song began one of Metallica , with the Parrot Zik you can clearly hear the ghost track of Jason’s bass.The noise reduction is pretty good not as the Bose but better than the others.Design : the main problem to me is here, respecting the name the headphone are heavy, too much heavy .About the design I love matte finish but all looks  cheaper than expected, I hope, I really hope that this material like in some other brands will not become “gluey”in the future.For sure I don’t like the “fixed” battery, while with the other you can find a way to change it I don't know what will happen with theseI’m not disappointed by this headphone but for the moment Bose quiet comfort for various reasons will remain my main one I’ll use heavys for sure at home.At the end the price, is in line with the other but is too high for what they give you

Review.Titre: I pre-ordered Heavys H1H headphones and…
Review.Contenu: I pre-ordered Heavys H1H headphones and they sound good. Not the best sounding pair I've owned but I guess what can be expected from a $200 pair.The Bluetooth has good range. The construction is decent. They definitely look cool and the ear cups are big and comfortable. The audio coming out of these is tuned to boost the mids. Bass response is kinda poor as are the high frequencies.I like the headphones but if you are basing your purchase decision on sound quality, I think the normal price of $299 is way too much. I've owned $300 pairs of headphones from Sure and Sony and they both had way better frequency response and clarity compared to the Heavys.Would I buy them again? Not for the $299 retail price.Knock a hundred dollars off and throw in the case and yeah, I'd buy them again.

I was really stoked when this first caught my attention on kick starter.  It was my first experience with KS.  I was very pleased with the abundance of updates and not at all bothered by the delays in development because I get it.  However, after I informed them I was going to have my mail forwarded (before they actually shipped it) they decided to ship it via a USPS method that sent it around the United States before “destroying” it per the the terms of the cheaper shipping price.  Needless to say I was livid.  However, several weeks later they made it right and shipped another pair that finally made it. For that, I cannot give 5 stars.Now for the product review:The headphones are Heavy literally as well as figuratively.  They are monstrous.  But I guess they need to be to package all of the drivers/speakers in them.  They sound good, but they bring out the bad as well as the good in whatever you play through them.  If a band has a well mastered album, it sounds great.  But if you play a favorite metal album from the 80’s that wasn’t produced by a god, then it sounds muddy. In general, the mids really come through on these.To be fair, I am still getting used to them, but would never wear them in public because they are awkwardly huge.  It is a great idea and lots of good technology going on, just need to make the design more efficient.  Will be following these guys to see what the Gen 2 design brings….
Well, the headphones are good, but I purchased an extra thing of custom outer shells and never received them.

Review.Titre: Heavys, great novelty, left to be desired
Review.Contenu: I genuinely appreciate that these are an interesting pair of headphones. It's just that gaming headphones from other competing brands are much better. The sound design of "Heavys" aren't what I hear from the other headphones and the drivers from Heavys have too much bass, muddling the audio and you'll need to use an external equalizer like from the Amazon Music app. Using that equalizer actually improved the audio from the Heavys and improved what the headphones are capable.  A great tip on the Amazon Music app for the equalizer settings use "Classical" or Custom and then Set the Sliders like this (60Hz is Bass so raise or lower to your like) (230Hz closer to center or lower depending on the other sliders) (910Hz this one seems to control the vocals, lower this to clear up vocals, raising it seems to mix the instrumental too much) (4kHz seems to work much like 910Hz so I just keep it the same as 910Hz) (14kHz is actually what makes the audio sound wider or something clearer? Lowering 14kHz makes the audio worst, so slide up and leave it there) Some nitpicks are on the features of the headphones, there's a loud voiceover when switching through modes very unique but just loud. Apparently the cables are separate from the main buy price of the product which is very ridiculous. The "tweeters" on the inside of the headphones provide no audible difference to audio or "soundstage" to what I can hear... I have use Phone audio and even CD player audio I thought maybe they provide higher acoustics or improvement on audio from guitars and vocals but nothing to what i can hear. Also, the cables, with the analog cable you can only use the Company own cable, it's a "2mm into 3mm" cable. You can't use "high end" cables that are "3mm into 3mm".Overall the headphones are an incredible build it's just that most people might find the Unboxing result a bit of a let down.Another Note the cable needs to be pressed into the headset until the "click" or full stop... Otherwise it's not appropriate working

Review.Titre: Had to pay an additional 42.02€ for the…
Review.Contenu: Had to pay an additional 42.02€ for the international shipment when I already paid for it when I bought them.

Review.Titre: The good, the meh, and the bad
Review.Contenu: I've had my Heavys in hand for a few months now and have used them enough to develop some thoughts. The Good1) The build quality does seem pretty decent.  They feel substantial in the hand and components seem to fit together well.  They don't feel cheap2) Battery life is really good.  I haven't had an opportunity to run them out, but my impression is no one will be complaining about battery charge issuesThe OK1) Overall, the cans fit well with decent clamping force and are reasonably comfortable.  Unfortunately, I'd be happier with a little less clamp.  2) The Optimus Prime announcement voice - cute for the first dozen times, then gets old.  At least turn the volume down on it.The Not So Good1) Sound quality.  I realize we all perceive sound differently and have different expectations of sound equipment, but out of the box these sound terrible to me.  The overall voicing is extremely bass heavy and muffled at the expense of mids and upper registers.  I am surprised the company got the initial voicing so wrong with these.Some seem to love it, some don't - I'm in the latter camp.  The good news is if you are connecting your streaming service through a phone, there are a number of EQ apps that will work to make these sound serviceable. I'm running Poweramp and it is worth the investment in time to bring the sound profile around to something a little more neutral.I'm more of a home audio listener than a headphone guy, but my final impression is that Heavys may be worthy of consideration for other similarly spec'd headphones in this price range.  I'd probably give 3.5 stars, but not an optionEdit - I've cleaned up a number of issues with some suggestions from others and the application of some careful parametric eq bands.  There is still some lack of presence, but still more than acceptable at this price point.  Consequently, I've updated my rating to 4 stars.  Without eq, this would be a one star review.Edit 2:  Going to have to bring this down to a 3 star again.  I'm finding the clamping force on my head is just too aggressive to wear for more than an hour at a time.

Review.Titre: The sound is very good, ANC isn’t
Review.Contenu: The sound is really good, but the ANC is really not that great, and the weight of the headphones is a bit too much.

Review.Titre: I don't like button set up...not as…
Review.Contenu: I don't like button set up...not as loud as I thought

Review.Titre: I still have Static when I put it in HB…
Review.Contenu: I still have Static when I put it in HB mode!

Review.Titre: I didn’t receive my shells yet
Personalized response when messaging them really appreciated.
Review.Contenu: Shipping took awhile and the tracking system wasn't updated (which isn't heavys fault). They did communicate well through messages on facebook and I appreciated that. In an amazon prime world, I think we all get used to 2 day shipping lol

Review.Titre: Great so far. Have a few suggestions
Review.Contenu: So far no complaints. I like the ergonomics of the buttons and volume control knob. They sound great. I would give 5 stars, but waiting for an app to possibly come out that supports the device and it would be great to have a suggested metal music source associated with Heavys. So don't take my rating the wrong way. I see the potential in this product to get even better.

Conectivity has been the only drawdown. Headphones cant decide its connected or not (2 devices connected).Practicaly it has been anoying as it is loud announcement from headphones when connection is lost. Meanwhile its said in my ears, for secconds I dont hear a meeting.Overall the headphones are excellent by sound performance actually. These small connectivity problems does not bother me so much. Only slightly reminds that these headphones are as shy as their listeners. Except loud CONNECTED”. But keep this up, all good

Finally arrived. Tracking is a joke.The headphones feel really well built.Just been playing with them for an hour now.Sound is very impressive.  Lots of bass.1st impression is very happy with purchase.Got to do a good comparison with a few pairs of sennheiser I have.Great headphone

The headphones are amazing and the customer service was even better! However, I received my headphones way later than expected. It said I would get them within 4-9 business days. But, I got them in about 12 business days. This being late was the reason for the 4 stars. Without this they would’ve been a solid 10 stars!!

Overall, these are very nice and comfortable headphones. I would recommend them to anyone. Pros:Very comfortable. Excellent noise cancellation. Excellent sound AFTER EQ. Excellent battery life. A few issues or annoyances I have experienced:1. High latency with Bluetooth to PC causing them to be unusable with wireless gaming and video watching. This is not an issue when wired. 2. The 2.5mm jack into the headphones needs to be jammed in to work properly. Not sure if I got an oversized cup or connector, but it’s slightly annoying because I don’t want to break anything. 3. I would recommend buying Dolby Atmos to fine tune the audio to your liking. Out of the box they are just ok. EQ’d and they are pretty amazing.

Just got these and am liking them so far. The ear cup material is very soft, and even though these weigh more than other headphones, they don't feel too heavy on my head or cause excess sweating. I wore my Heavys all day yesterday without any ear pain or other issues.I also own a pair of Sennheiser Momentum 3 headphones and will use those for comparison. The Sennheisers have more clarity in the audio, but the Heavys sound louder and more energetic. The Heavys have reduced treble and more emphasis on bass, which I like because it allows you to listen at higher volumes without getting any high-pitched treble screeching in your ears. You aren't getting a "neutral" sound with the Heavys, but they are fun to listen to.My only complaint is something that many others might view as a positive: It sounds like the noise cancelling function is on all the time, even when I turn noise cancelling off. Maybe I have a defective pair or something, but I hear no difference at all between noise cancelling and regular mode. The only way I could turn the noise cancelling off was by turning off the headphones completely and using a wired connection.Overall, I'm enjoying these so far and think they will only get better once the app is rolled out.

Review.Titre: Lost headphones,reshipped thanks to  amazing customer service
Review.Contenu: The team worked with me the whole way on reshooting my lost items was friendly and courteous. Heavy’s was great to work with and I’m excited for them to arrive as I’m sure they will be as good as I’m thinking if not better

Review.Titre: Well it is not standard headphones.
Review.Contenu: I am not really an audiophile , so I can't hear the tiny difference of the sound, but it is still much more better than I had.

Overall very good headphones. Great sound with lots of details and very punchy, especially the bass. This leads to one thing I dislike about the product: As with most headphones, there is too much bass and not enough focus on the hights -at least for my ears. To me as a Metal drummer I‘d particularly love to hear the cymbals, especially high hat and ride, more in detail.

It would have gotten the full 5 stars apart from one probably with mine which I'll go into. So, to start off its well constructed. It feels really solid! The sound us great ans everything works as it should and its easy to use the ear cup dials. Now, onto why i gave 4 stars. The headset i got seems big, as in its loose on my head. Its not a good fit and cant do anything to make it tighter. Sure its very comfortable, but if i look down, or up. It slides off my head, which is annoying if im moving about the house or outside with these on. And i wish something could be done about it. But, overall a solid headset!

Review.Titre: These are great for the ones who want…
Review.Contenu: These are great for the ones who want to get out of the skull candy territory with the the same kind of bass. Podcasts and YouTube videos go easily with these headphones and maybe a little music too but really you can get the same with a 50mil driver easy. I love the concept I only hope you expand Heavys!

Review.Titre: They sent frequent updates along the…
Review.Contenu: They sent frequent updates along the process. There was an issue that the tracking number provided no updates until the day it was to be delivered, but it was delivered nonetheless.The only reason I didn't go with 5 stars is because I purchased the bundle with a custom shell, and I haven't received an update on the shell delivery in over a month or so. It had originally mentioned some time in October they would be shipped, and we're now near the end of November.

Review.Titre: After a few weeks of listening: Really fun!
Review.Contenu: After a few weeks of listening: The Heavys sound really great and are a lot of fun. Depending on the choice of music the instruments sound like attending a metal/rock concert. Guitars shredding like hell, drums like f*** yeah!ANC is not really necessary, the passive protection from outside is already great.Disadvantages: This direct sound needs some getting used to and can be exhausting. The Heavys are huge and are warming in summer. (Though, no compact gear could deliver this sound.)But overall it was worth the wait. I'm glad I've backed this project.

Review.Titre: Overall best headphones for the price point
Review.Contenu: The sound quality is amazing, the features are amazing and overall I feel the energy of the bands I listen too as if they were on stage. The reason Im giving 4 stars and not 5 is because it did take 5 months to get the headphones and there is something off with the Hell Blocker, like it will give feedback on one side more than the other. I emailed support about this issue and they have stated that there will be an app launched towards the end of 2023 to update the firmware and fix this problem. Once that has been fixed it will be easy to forgive the 5 month wait time and I will upgrade my review to 5 stars!

These are fantastic sounding headphones and I'm glad I took a shot and tried them. Because I own lots of different headphones and cables, I ordered ONLY the headphones and not the bundle. I was disappointed to learn that to use them wired, requires a 2.5MM cable end, versus the more common 3.5mm cable end –which is not obvious in the least from your website. So I ended up ordering the cable separately anyway. Sharing this in hopes I can save someone else the same trouble.

Review.Titre: I am happy with the heavies I received
Review.Contenu: I am happy with the heavies I received. I am very proud to be one of the first to help with this endeavor. I still have not received the covers I ordered. After using them heavily, my volume knob is spotty. It cuts out and doesn’t get very loud. They are too heavy to head bang with. I also prefer my skullcandy crushers with the adjustable bass knob. Otherwise, they are great the sound is very clear, I am finding they bring out parts of the music I’ve never noticed before!! Great job gentlemen!!!!

Product is as advertised and was happy to wait and support a start up, but delays were terrible and a lot of repeated promises on delivery were missed. I ordered January 2022 as a birthday present for myself expecting to receive by August, and when they missed that I thought oh well Christmas then. I didn’t receive until fall 2023, as they shipped based on location instead of when orders were received which wasn’t cool.

Great headphones! Comfortable, great sound. Love the compact carrying case too! Only complaint is the "announcer/narrator" voice (for on/off/noise canceling/bluetooth) is very loud and kind of obnoxious. Would love future functionality to reduce this volume or replace with other voice/sound packs. Maybe even user-created and company-approved custom packs?

I was completely sold on the idea of headphones made specifically for heavy metal music and I really like the sound quality and construction of the product. Very good noise cancellation (hell blocker). The only knock is that they make my ears very hot in long listening sessions. Overall, though, I am pleased with my Heavys.

Review.Titre: Horrible wait time from prepaid ordering 3/1 to 9/15
Review.Contenu: Horrible wait time, however…Over all very happy with the sound quality, the battery life is good but not great, the earpads don’t feel like they are suited to sweating as they really hold in the moisture(and block outside noise) so need to be taken off and wiped down during my recording sessions.
No fatigue during the long listening sessions. Sound quality is solid.Voice comments of the actions becomes boring after awhile. So it'll be great to have an option of disabling it.

Review.Titre: Experiencing the 8 speaker system was a…
Review.Contenu: Experiencing the 8 speaker system was a little jarring at first, especially when I'm primarily listening to symphonic and progressive subgenres. I started listening to bands like Sleep Token, Dream Theater, Symphony X and Nightwish in whole new ways, being able to dissect the voicings in the instrumentation so much more clearly. I can't wait for everything to come. Only thing I would ask is, being I already have a pair, if you could ship it the custom shells a bit more quickly...

The headphones delivers as promised. Decent battery life. The monster mode voice takes a bit getting used to, but hey....What I didn't quite like was waiting more than a year for them since payment. But, it was a crowdfunding pre-payment deal, so, it was expected.

After 2 days of usage, the product seems awesome (sound & material quality, casing)!!!!The only sad part was that the item was shipped in late August, was delivered to me approx. one month later [had to pay an extra ~100$ for customs which sucks big time] and the limited 1-year warranty states that the countdown starts from the day the item was shipped.

Review.Titre: H1H headphones are all good in build…
Review.Contenu: H1H headphones are all good in build quality, sounds, accessories, packages, as I expected.Just need an app (iOS, Android) to control eq, HB (ANC), hear through, etc... Currently, uncomfortable to control by buttons only.

The product is phenomenal! Great sound, comfortable, and honestly works great with almost every genre of music. The one part of the experience I didn’t enjoy was the fact that I wasn’t notified when the product had shipped or what company it had shipped with. I ordered the headphones back when it was still on preorder so I was constantly checking my emails for an updated status and then the headphones showed up out of the blue. Only reason this is not a 5 star is because I wish I would have received an email with the shipping information.

Review.Titre: Can't listen passively with cord, but nice otherwise...
Review.Contenu: Really great sounding headphones that are also very comfortable. I'm very happy with them aside from the fact that right out of the box the cord input for passive listening doesn't have a stable connection. Anytime the cord is touched, one side or the other cuts out until I can move it just right to get both channels to come through. Really annoying considering how good a quality everything else about it is. I considered sending them back for a replacement, but considering I waited a year and a half to receive them, I couldn't bear waiting again, and for who knows how long. I'm pretty satisfied just using the bluetooth method, but still wish I could listen passively when I want. Oh well... I'd still recommend them.

Review.Titre: So grateful to ha been on the ground…
Review.Contenu: So grateful to have been on the ground level of this wonderful product launch. Best headphones I've EVER had, geared directly to the target genre we all bang our heads to!!!!  Excellent, service, updates, packaging, product and sound quality all superb. I would have included a proper c type charging cord as I was forced to purchase one. Overall, highly reccomended for anyone who loves their metal clear, crisp and bloody LOUD. Thx Heavys, was worth the wait.

sound is great when used via bluetoothwhen used with aux-cable the sound quality and volume were worse for some reason (no clue if thats normal)at low music volume i could still hear some backround noise even with the "hellblocker" active noice canceling on. it made no discernible difference to me.they are extremely comfortable to wear. the controls are easily reached and the microphone seems to record at a very good quality too.i am very pleased with these headphones.

Review.Titre: The best except for one thing
Review.Contenu: I love these headphones, really like the sound and being able to distinguish different instruments and notes, like even guitarron in mariachi music sounds much clearer.There is one thing, thiugh, and it is that sometimes, not often, but maybe once a month, the bottom left bass speaker will start some kind of interference noise and it won’t stop until you turn the headset off and leave it for a while.Other than that, they’re great!

The product itself is amazing. The only issue was in the last few months of the kickstarter. I felt that we were no longer a priority. No questions were answered and when people (customers) became upset the company flat out said they would not be answering any "rude comments". To me that showed me a lack of a mature company. Once the product arrived most of us didn't care about the wait anymore as the product was amazing. Great bass, clear details you would not have found with a different product. As well as an overall amazing design. Looking forward to an app to go along with the product.

These things sound awesome!!! I have actually welled up a bit listening to some of my favorite songs and feeling that "first time hearing it" feeling again. I can hear more layers and details than ever before and these are very worth it for the sound alone. The sound is so good for this level of headphones, that I only take one star away for the so-so build quality/materials, oddball controls, bad sound insulation (everyone can hear what I am listening to), weird aux cable shenanigan's and the extreme shipping delays.That sound tho... chefs kiss!!!

The Heavy’s design for their first headphones are phenomenal! The sound quality is great, with you truly feeling like you are at a metal concert without the music getting so loud it hurts your eardrums. The firmware on the device could use a little bit of work with the polishing. Three examples come to mind;When you turn on the headphones and go to the noise canceling mode as they coined “Hell Blockers” (very rad name in my opinion) the headphones give the message “Hell Blockers Activated”. When you boot the headphones right into the hell blocker mode it will repeat the messages that were shown multiple times. Secondly, when you are at minimum volume it will play the message “Minimum Volume” at a rather high volume, which is a pretty big shock to my ears whenever it happens without me expecting. Thirdly, pretty minor actually, the headphones have a pretty large band on them so if you’re walking around with them on or if you move your head a lot they are pretty liable to fall off and they generally just feel loose while wearing them.

Review.Titre: While I would have loved to have…
Review.Contenu: While I would have loved to have received them sooner, I understand that things take time.  I appreciated the communication throughout the process.  I like the headphones though I would love to be able to tweak the sound a bit.  My listening preference is a bit more treble-y than the default Heavys tone.

Review.Titre: Awesome headphones needs to be thin setup with EQ for a perfect fit
Review.Contenu: The product is really good, waiting really worth it!Headphones are really solid and fit perfectly on your head, they are absolutely comfortable. Pure bassy sound, which could be improved by EQ and detailed software set up.From the cons: Undefined timeframe for the delivery (but the bakers waited around 2 years, so my case is quite fast). And the most bad surprise: the shipment was sent from Hong Kong and additionally to product's costs and delivery I had to pay 50 euros of VAT&customs duty (because the product came outside EU), these specific numbers are valid for Spain and might vary depending on country. This was really an unexpected surprise. I really enjoyed the sound of headphones, brutal voice if included assistant and especially the Hell Blocker and Transparent modes, which are very useful on outside and on the street/public transport.So if you are OK with these cons and able to set them up precisely for a perfect sound and wait how long's needed, I don't think you can find something nice for such a price. I am using them with Android and BlackPlayer with build-in EQ, but it's only the first day so far. I'll update my review later after I find a perfect set up.

The headphones sound amazing. I like to wear them when commuting to work, so I can listen to music loudly to switch off, especially on the way home. But what bothers me is the spontaneous switching off and on of the headphones.  They do reconnect to the source, but it's still annoying...I hope for a solution as soon as possible in the announced app. I assume that the problem can be solved with a software update.

Review.Titre: HEAVYS... are they really so good as advertised?
Review.Contenu: The HEAVYS quality of built materials and construction is very good, nice to hold them in your hands. They are like a good massive gadget with small buttons to turn on, turn off, adjust volume etc... but I'm a little disappointed in the sound quality.... 2 large speakers, 2 beepers on each side, but for some reason my old Sony MDR1A headphones sounds  more clearly in High Frequency range. HEAVYS sound is heavy, bassy, but not so clear as I want to hear... Anyway, after a few minutes of listening, the ears adapts to the sound of HEAVYS and it doesn't feels so bad anymore.

Review.Titre: I received my headphones back at the…
Review.Contenu: I received my headphones back at the end of august and i had to put them through some tests. like riding bike and just listening to the record player then the true test mowing the lawn on my riding tractor the true test of noise cancelling and i gotta say i'm truly impressed they passed on every level i highly recommend these to anyone

Review.Titre: The best headphones I constantly use
Review.Contenu: I was super excited to recieved my first pair of heavy's Headphones. I am very glad about the audio-quality. The Design is marvelous-metal-fan-ish and has very good ear comfort. I listen to music almost every day 5+ hours with them and They don't push onto the ears. I would recommend these Headphones to any friend who's looking for good over-ear Headphones. "But why then only 4 Stars?"Well, I have to admit that my head ist a bit broad, and I am scared that These Headphones May break. And the headpad could be a Bit more comfortable. Anyway, all in all 9,5/10 would recommend this headphones! Stay Heavy!

Review.Titre: Great sound, but takes the heavy part a bit too much
Review.Contenu: The sound is absolutely amazing in these, they are generally comfortable to wear, and the battery life is great. Only thing I would change is how much the headband can adjust. I have a fairly robust noggin, but even at their smallest size, they are a little bit big on me and tend to slide downs and rest on my ears, which causes pain after around an hour of wearing them. This could also be resolved if there was a way to make them a little bit lighter.

I backed their first headphone on Kickstarter. Although the message was not always what we wanted to hear (read setbacks), they remained honest. With a year of they delivered on their promise. In the end it was well worth the wait: the headphone is sturdy, has a nice fit, and the music sounds really good. The ear pod isolate so well, I do not need to enable the Hell Blocker (ANC). I’m able to hear details in the music I never heard before.

The sound and quality of these headphones is fantastic. I am very happy with those aspects of the Heavy's. However, as the owner of a normal size head, the fact that the earcups hang all the way down to my neck with the headband adjusted to the smallest setting makes these headphones unusable for me. In that way I am terribly disappointment in my Heavy's purchase. Good Luck!

Review.Titre: Amazing sounding headphones - a little big on the head
Review.Contenu: These are great headphones that were totally worth the wait from the initial Kickstarter investment. The sound quality is amazing, they are comfortable, and very cool looking - all things that I really appreciate. I almost never wear any other headphones now!My only complaint is that the headband is a little big so the ear cups are not really tight on my head. I have a pretty average/slightly large head so it's not like I'm out of the ordinary here but even with no adjustments to the headband, they slide around on my head. This is fine because I mostly use them sitting at the computer, anyway, but when I want to wear them and do anything else it can get pretty annoying.

These are amazing. Noise canceling and great sound. Had to take the bass down and other equalizer effects but I got it just right I think. Thanks so much for making heavy metal headphones!! Rock on 🤘🏽

Despite size, super comfy. Loudness tech seems to work - love how not fatiguing these are to listen to. There are times I wish I could have more high end/clarity so I can't call these the best headphones for every song, but nothing I've listened to do better than what the heavys are good at.

the headphones have an amazing sound! they are truly made for heavy metal. the product looks good, and is durable, but the weight is a bit heavy, and the  headphones ergonomics needs to be upgraded a little (when comparing to Sony and BOSE).
Sound is great; however I didn’t receive the \m/ spike skins I ordered and the power charging cord is defective with both ends with the same connection, blah. Operationally, I’m solid.

These headphones are simply the best! The sound quality is facemeltingly good, however I do wish that the charger that came with it was already built for standard USB drives. Despite needing to buy an adapter, still 100% worth it.

Review.Titre: Worth the Investment; However, be Willing to EQ
Review.Contenu: I think the project overall was a success. Received my Heavys faster than I expected. The build quality is exceptional. I expect these will last for many years to come, and I’m excited to have them. After some equalizer work, they sound good to me. My only point of criticism: I thought out of the box the sound was muddy and not well suited for metal. Nothing a little work with EQ can’t fix. Apple has several presets that suffice (e.g., electronic), and even further improvements can be made manually if one is willing to. I’m not the engineer(s) of these headphones, and I’m very ignorant about how sound signatures are developed for out of the box. If they could arrive out of the box sounding more suitable to metal with more clarity, I think some folks would feel less shocked, like I did. These headphones are an investment (and a good one at that), but if they could sound better for metal out of the box, I think that would be an improvement. I’ve read some angry posts on Reddit, but I don’t think they understand that EQ can fix their dissatisfactions. I hope this makes sense.

Review.Titre: Heavy’s are a great option for people…
Review.Contenu: Heavy’s are a great option for people looking for a good solid headphone. They are good for all types of heavy music as well as classical music and jazz. They are comfortable and the noise canceling performs well. The only criticism I have is the weight is a little heavy but after some use I became used to it. I would highly recommend them to everyone.

Great headphone!It's a bit big and heavy (what's in a name).Sound is great! I have nothing to compare it to tho, no other headphones.I was one of the original backers from the Kickstarter campaign (feb 22). I contacted the company mid September 23 about the status and surprise, surprise my order was just processed. I got the pair delivered last week after a slow delivery process. Tracking was not up to date most of the time...After I paid the customs last week things went fast.Very happy metal head now \../

I was really impressed with the headphones. Not only do they bring out every nuance in the music (bands like Archspire really shine on these things) but they also block out everything else so you can just enjoy the Metal. They took forever, but they were worth the wait.I'm only giving it 4 stars because of the AUX 2.5 jack instead of using the proper 3.5mm. These are sitting in your chair and enjoying your Undeath live album turning on your record player kind of headphones. And using 2.5 feels like a ploy by them so you'll buy their overpriced cords. The latter reasoning making my disappointment more legitimate.Also, I scrolled through some of the negative reviews and found some of the pettiest crap I've ever seen. Some complaining that the voice was 'too loud'. If your ears aren't irreparably damaged from years of listening to Metal, then wth did you buy heavy metal headphones for!?

Initially I was upset that they kept getting delayed but the year and a half wait was worth it in the end.  I love having multiple connection options. Bluetooth for the gym and chores, analog and/or digital connections for streaming and gaming.  They are a tad heavy(no pun intended) they tend to slide off of im doing any exercises at the gym that require me to be in anything but an upright position, easy enough to work around that.  Only dropped 5hem once so far in the 2 months I've had them and only a small scuff to show for it.  Sound quality, well nothing to say other than a 12/10.  Great bass without being overpowering.  Love the extra tweeters and their forward relocation. Very big, full sound.  Even does a decent job at making up for the poor sound quality of some audio files and low reception area where your Plex/Spotify streaming might start to degrade. They fit very well for their size.  My biggest concern is the hinge for folding the ear cups, I haven't had any issues but I always feel like I'm about to break something when I unfold them.  Let me be clear, they don't feel "cheap" but just something about the way the hinge lock into position.  But for that I took away one star.  I'm careful with my property but I don't like feeling like I have to be unnecessarily overprotective.  I would give 4.5 stars but this survey doesn't allow 1/2 stars.  Great product!! Highly recommend

The headphones are absolutely phenomenal, well made and have a cool voice when turning on, pairing with bluetooth etc. the case is real good quality and the sound quality is the best i have ever had on headphones. the 2 reasons why this is a 4 star review is, it is made in china and so a plug is not included to charge them, also there was a massive import tax for the item as well as having to provide lots of paper work to get the item delivered. I have to say, i was disappointed to discover that it was manufactured in china because of some of the substandard electrical stuff i have encountered from china, but i am hoping that these headphones will stay good for a long time

Review.Titre: I really really love the sound of these…
Review.Contenu: I really really love the sound of these headphone, really great! The only thing I don’t like so much about them is they are quite big and lose on my head, whenever I put my head down & I have them on, the headphone top part that is on my head goes forward. It would be great to be able to adjust them a bit more to my head size. Maybe I’ll wear a hat simuliez using them around the house.

Review.Titre: The headset sounds very good but…
Review.Contenu: The headset sounds very good but occasionally there is a buzz in one side. That could be Spotify as it's nort constant.  I would have set up the set to fold for storage and the cushions should be replaceable.  Otherwise everything is great.

Service was ok.  I was an early-ish backer, but I seemed to be amongst the last to get my headphones.  Maybe that was because I purchased a case for them?  I don't know.  I didn't get tracking numbers until i emailed, and by the time I got a response, the headphones were at my door.
Solid, explosive bass sound. A bit too big to wear on public outings. Needs more options with an app to control better for people who don't prefer to do things manually.

Review.Titre: Worth the price for any metal head who values sound quality
Review.Contenu: Definitely delivered on sound quality, never had better headphones than these. Battery life is also good, my only issue is sometimes I lose the Bluetooth connection for a second or two even when my phone is in my pocket, so the music either gets interrupted with a pause, or the voice cuts in mid-song to tell me it reconnected.

Review.Titre: I say if your audio equipment can play…
Review.Contenu: I say if your audio equipment can play heavy and extreme metal music without a hitch, it can play anything. The Heavys headphones is a brilliant piece of audio engineering. The headphones, even though a bit heavy from the additional drivers and battery pack, is built sturdy and sits on my large head quite comfortably. The sound is loud and crystal clear with excellent separation of instruments and the connectivity options work flawlessly. It is difficult, if not impossible, to get a product of this quality at this price point anywhere else. There were obvious delays in creating and marketing a complex brand new item from scratch, and of course, there are some minor implementation issues that still need ironing out, but the engineering team behind Heavys has done a magnificent job. It took almost three years for me to receive my Heavys but I'm ecstatic to finally have it.

Review.Titre: The quality of the device is fantastic
Review.Contenu: The quality of the device is fantastic, from the build to the listening experience. Communication with Heavy's while waiting for my headphones to ship was a little off putting, however I understand it was a pre-purchase, so I signed up for that. I feel there is a bit of a lack of technical documentation or support with regards to using these for digital on a PC, since when it is plugged in, Windows 11 has no clue what the device is as the device does not report what it is to the system. I reached out to Heavy's for a driver and got no response. This could easily be a 5-star rating with a PC driver and an app that lets you get a custom sound profile directly to the headphone as most equalizers in apps are absolutely terrible and distort your sound and degrades the sound quality substantially.

Review.Titre: Good budget headphone with a few downsides you should know
Review.Contenu: Testing for a couple of monthsFirst things first:You have to consider, it's the first product and not as complete as established competitors.You'll get a very good headphone with a few downsides.The downsides:- you can't turn this thing low. It's always kinda loud. So if you want to work and listen to music on very low volume, it's just not possible- at the moment you can't play with the audio settings, but am update might come- there is a horrible loud voice narrating everything you do "POWER ON, CONNECTING, CONNECTED, HELLBLOCKER ON" it's ridiculous and very annoying and even embarrassing in public- the Bluetooth connection with both of my laptop works, but the audio on my headphones sounds really bad, like if a tin can. No problems with mobile devices whatsoever- you have a move were you can enable the microphones to overcome the noise blocking. The mode works well, but you have to press two buttons at once and don't get any audio feedback of it's turned on or notHope I could help you a bit

It took me almost 3 months to finally get around to pairing this puppy up, I now regret taking so God dam long. All I'll say is WOW!!! If you are looking for thumping drums, hard riffs and screaming vocals with a new set of headphone's earmuffs vibrating off your head (ALL at the same time) then look no more! Be warned though this product is NOT for crisp treble or smooth relaxing vocal tones (EG: Classical, etc) If you are a serious Audiophile you'll most likely feel let down, yet....Should you be a Heavy Metal / Hard Rock enthusiast you ain't gonna add these to your Headphone collection for anything else other than a 'full on' head banging, devil horns salute  experience. That my heavy metal / Hard Rock friend is exactly what you'll get. I really hope Heavys put this same recipe into a pair of earbuds with 10-12mm drivers for their next venture, I have a feeling it's already on the horizon due to the massive TWS earbud market they'd be silly not to put a little R&D into a future related product with a dedicated App. The only let downs (very minor) and reason for one star less in my review is the fiddly little buttons and knobs placed on the underside of the right ear cup. They could be either slightly larger or have some rubberised or textured grip and spaced a little further apart seeing they are so small. One other thing is the ANC switch design hasn't been completly or thoroughly thought through, the user can easily toggle the headphones off when in Bluetooth mode is switched in the opposite direction. I am sure these minor faults will be corrected for version 2.0 (perhaps move some switches to the upper fork on either or both sides of the ear cups?) That would make the Heavys even more unique and intuitive to everything else on the market. I'd also love to see a flaming Red devils horns hand 🤘 logo on the ear cup as a new earcup design housing either a button styled battery with small toggle on/off switch to power that glowing logo OR a 'glow in the dark' logo powered by UV flashlight or naturally powered by the sun after a few hours using luminescent liquid / material. Attention Heavys R&D....Check out The Voltage Ring (another KS project some years ago) for an example of that technology. I think the later rather than the former may be an easier process? Or perhaps give the Heavys community a say or which they'd prefer if you are considering this option? Anyway to end this review if you are second guessing yourself in picking up a pair of Heavys then don't just do it as you just won't find a listening experience anywhere else in the flooded Headphone market. Cannot wait for the earbuds to drop hopefully in the near future. We'll done to Axcel and his entire engineering crew, hats off to a job very well done! Flash... OUT
